newsitem.title: FINLAND: KONECRANES BUYS FRENCH COPAS' CRANE UNIT.
newsitem.headline: KONECRANES BUYS FRENCH COPAS' CRANE UNIT.

text.p: Finnish crane maker KCI Konecranes International said in a statement on Wednesday it had bought French Copas' crane unit Copas ALM S.A. for an undisclosed sum.
"The net sales of Copas ALM are approximately 20 million francs and the number of employees is around 40," it said.
It said Copas ALM was a recognised provider of crane maintenance services to the nuclear power industry in France.
"It has supplied cranes to French nuclear power stations and has maintenance service contracts with many of them," it said.
"As part of KCI Konecranes group, Copas will concentrate on process crane maintenance as well as on strengthening its position as a supplier of new cranes," it said.
Last year, Konecranes bought its current French units Matman Konecranes and CGP-Konecranes, it noted.
Konecranes said Copas S.A. which is owned by Joseph Labrosse wanted to focus on its core activities, mainly elevators and fork lift trucks.
